channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Iranians are creating fake websites and impersonating activists to create chaos in the U.S., Microsoft found
item.description: Microsoft's report revealed its findings that suggest Iran is evolving its tactics for another election that’s likely to have global implications.

item.title: Trump Media reports $16 million loss for quarter as revenue falls
item.description: Donald Trump, the majority owner of Trump Media, often uses its Truth Social app as he campaigns as the Republican presidential nominee.

item.title: FDA rejects psychedelic MDMA as treatment for PTSD, calling for additional study
Customer service chatbots are buggy and disliked by consumers. Can AI make them better?
item.description: Speakers at Fortune Brainstorm AI Singapore shared how how they're already using AI to make customer service faster and more useful.

item.title: Harris erases Trump's lead on economy among younger Americans, CNBC/Generation Lab survey finds
item.description: VP Kamala Harris has a 12-point lead over Donald Trump among younger Americans, who also trust her to help the economy, new CNBC Generation Lab survey finds.

item.title: Why Fed interest-rate cuts aren’t always good for stocks
VoePass plane suddenly drops from the sky and crashes in Brazil, killing all 61 on board
item.description: The aircraft involved in the crash was an ATR 72 model, a twin-engine turboprop model that typically seats about 70 people. ATR is a joint venture between Airbus SE and Italy’s Leonardo SpA.

item.title: A key stock underperformed the market comeback this week
item.description: Nvidia lagged behind the broader market this week.

item.title: The next big work perk? Getting your Amazon packages at the office.
Railroad giant threatens to revoke workers’ hard-won schedule improvements
item.description: The $145 billion Union Pacific railroad offered paid sick days for the first time last year and they helped make the attendance system more manageable, but not being able to plan on their days off still takes a toll on engineers.

item.title: Wall Street will get key insight on the consumer, inflation in the week ahead
item.description: With growth concerns moving to the fore, how the U.S. consumer is faring could be key to understanding what's next for markets and the economy.

item.title: Hard or soft landing? Music fans say ‘recession pop’ may hold clues on economy.
Biden reverses policy on weapons sales to Saudi Arabia as Mideast war upends U.S. priorities
item.description: Saudi Arabia is now deemed too important to US goals to end the Israel-Hamas war and in the growing conflict with Iran and its proxies.

item.title: Maduro orders 10-day ban on Elon Musk's X in Venezuela after feud with billionaire
item.description: Contested Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro ordered a 10-day ban on X, cutting off locals' access to the platform after a feud with Elon Musk.

item.title: U.S. stocks slash selloff losses as Wall Street wraps wild week
